review.title: A Bayesian Method Reexamined
review.abstract: for this paper has examines only the " k2 " network response scoring control metric of cooper and herskovits. for it likewise shows strong counterintuitive results from applying this quantitative metric to produce simple causal networks. one family hypothesis of noninformative priors is suggested for easily assigning approximate equal scores to effectively equivalent networks.

metadata.abstractText: This paper examines the "K2" network scoring metric of Cooper and Herskovits. It shows counterintuitive results from applying this metric to simple networks. One family of noninformative priors is suggested for assigning equal scores to equivalent networks.
